name: sfpwowerscript-authenticateorg-task
description: Authorizes a Salesforce org using either a private key file that has been uploaded to a personal connected app [JWT] or username/password, This task is part of SFPowerscripts
helpMarkDown: Read more about this task here https://sfpowerscripts.com/tasks/common-utility-tasks/authenticate%20an%20org/
author: azlam.abdulsalam

inputs.name: method
inputs.label: Authentication Method
inputs.helpMarkDown: The method to authenticate this org

inputs.name: salesforce_connection
inputs.label: Salesforce Connection
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the service connection name for your Salesforce Org

inputs.name: jwt_key_file
inputs.label: Secure file containing the private key
inputs.helpMarkDown: Secure file containing the private key

inputs.name: username
inputs.label: Username
inputs.helpMarkDown: Authentication username which is authorized to use the connected app or username for the org if using credential method

inputs.name: securitytoken
inputs.label: Security Token
inputs.helpMarkDown: Security Token for this particular user, Security Token requirement can be removed by ensuring the particular user profile is allowed to connect to Salesforce from different IP ranges.

inputs.name: alias
inputs.label: Alias
inputs.helpMarkDown: Alias for the org to be used in the subsequent scripts

inputs.name: isdevhub
inputs.label: Authenticate this org as a Production/DevHub
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enable this option if a devhub is to be authenticated

inputs.name: clientid
inputs.label: clientid
inputs.helpMarkDown: OAuth client ID (sometimes called the consumer key)

inputs.name: isTelemetryEnabled
inputs.label: Send Anonymous Usage Telemetry
inputs.helpMarkDown: Enabling this will help us to collect information on the tasks and improve services. All information collected is anonymised, please check code repository to understand what data is collected
